articles.content:
Image copyrightGetty Images
There is a simple, but crucial number at the heart of understanding the threat posed by the coronavirus. It is guiding governments around the world on the actions needed to save lives, and it gives us clues to the extent that lock… [+4724 chars]

articles.author: By Joe Pinkstone For Mailonline
articles.title: MoD tests insect repellent to see if it kills the strain of coronavirus that causes COVID-19 - Daily Mail
articles.description: The company which manufactures the product in the UK, Citrefine International Ltd, based in Leeds, called on the Government to test the product and see if it is effective.
articles.content:
A commercial insect repellent is being tested by the Ministry of Defence (MoD) to see if it can kill the novel coronavirus causing the current pandemic. 
Citriodiol, found in Mosi-guard, has previously proved effective at killing other coronaviruses, includi… [+6726 chars]

articles.title: Coronavirus: Tens of thousands more book tests in England - BBC South East Wales
articles.description: Staff and residents of care homes, over-65s and people who cannot work at home are now eligible for testing.
articles.content:
Image caption
 There are now 43 regional testing sites across the UK, according to the government
Tens of thousands of people have booked coronavirus tests after the government expanded who can apply in England.
